text: The Knicks are still determined to keep OG Anunoby in free agency, sources tell ESPN, but the ability to resign center Isaiah Hartenstein becomes more difficult now. The Knicks are loading up on wings to match up with the NBA champion Boston Celtics.

author: wojespn
text: Most importantly in the deal, per sources: Houston relinquishes the right to swap a Houston/OKC first-round pick for Brooklyn's 2025 first-round pick. The Nets control their own pick as they go into a full rebuild -- especially important in talented 2025 draft.

author: wojespn
text: As intrigued as the Rockets have been about Durant, they're determined to use the Suns picks to be aggressive on deals elsewhere now, sources tell ESPN. Phoenix has made it clear that they want to run it back with this group, and Houston is seeking a major upgrade now.

author: wojespn
text: The Knicks go deeper into the Villanova national championship roster — bringing Mikal Bridges to join his old teammates and close friends Jalen Brunson, Josh Hart and Donte DiVencenzo. https://t.co/G544CT02zI

author: wojespn
text: The implications of the Rockets landing the Suns' picks?  Houston wants to trade for Kevin Durant and that becomes far easier if they can return the Suns' picks that they gave up in the Durant deal to the Nets. Suns have said they're keeping Durant for now, but that could change next season. But now, Houston has the picks to make the Suns whole again.

author: wojespn
text: More in deal: Houston acquires 2029 more favorable of Dallas and Phoenix first-round pick and acquires right to swap Houston first-round pick for less favorable Dallas first and Phoenix first, per sources.

author: wojespn
text: Another massive deal: Brooklyn has a deal with Houston to return the Nets’ 2026 first-round pick for a 2027 Phoenix Suns first-round pick, sources tell ESPN. Rockets also acquire 2025 right to swap Houston/OKC first for 2025 Suns first-round pick. More details coming on picks deal.

author: wojespn
text: The Knicks are sending four unprotected picks (2025, 2027, 2029, 2031) a 2025 protected Milwaukee first, a 2028 unprotected pick swap and a 2025 second-round pick for Mikal Bridges and a 2026 second-round pick, sources tell ESPN.

author: wojespn
text:
RT @malika_andrews: We are previewing the 2024 Draft right NOW on ESPN! 

@wojespn @Rjeff24 @JayBilas @BobbyMarks42 @DraftExpress @Andraya_…

author: wojespn
text: Anunoby's agent Drew Morrison and Austin Brown of @CAA_Basketball have been talking with Leon Rose for several days on the deal and landed on the $212.5 million deal this afternoon that'll keep him out of July free agency, sources tell ESPN.

author: wojespn
text: In 24 hours, the Knicks traded for Mikal Bridges and secured a five-year deal with OG Anunoby. Massive impact for the organization in its pursuit of Eastern Conference championship contention.

author: wojespn
text: BREAKING: The Brooklyn Nets have agreed in principle on a trade to send F Mikal Bridges to the New York Knicks for Bojan Bogdanovic, four unprotected first-round picks, a protected first-round pick via Bucks, an unprotected pick swap and a second-rounder, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/TEGsIpoa3b

author: wojespn
text: The Knicks pay a steep price to land one of the league’s most coveted trade assets and the Nets get a massive haul to replenish assets and embark on a rebuild with mass cap space and future draft picks.

author: wojespn
text: The Detroit Pistons are hiring Dallas Mavericks executive Dennis Lindsey as the Senior VP of Basketball Operations, sources tell ESPN. Lindsey constructed the Utah Jazz era of Donovan Mitchell and Rudy Gobert and now goes to Detroit to join Trajan Langdon's new group.

author: wojespn
text: Lindsey spent the past year in an advisory role under GM Nico Harrison in Dallas.

author: wojespn
text: Langdon and Lindsey -- who spent years with the Spurs and Rockets before building a perennial playoff team in Utah -- bring the Pistons significant track records of success in player personnel.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
A year after 49 wins, the sixth seed and the No. 13 ranked defense, the Suns plummeted to third-worst in the NBA on defense and went 10-18 after the All-Star break. 

For the third straight offseason, Phoenix is changing coaches.

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Sacramento Kings and GM Monte McNair mutually parting ways after five seasons: https://t.co/8T5CGrU2j5

author: ShamsCharania
text:
The Kings have won 40 or more games in three straight seasons under McNair’s leadership. Before this streak, they had not won 40 games in any season since 2005-06. 

The Kings had a .488 win percentage under McNair — compared to a .362 win percentage for the 15 years prior.

text:
Otto Porter Jr. announced he’s retiring:
 
“For the past 11 years, I had the chance to live my lifelong dream of playing in the NBA,” said Porter Jr. “That dream was capped by winning an NBA Championship! Unfortunately, my body is not allowing me to play at the level that I expect of myself, and I have therefore decided to retire.”

author: wojespn
text: ESPN Sources: The Detroit Pistons have permission to interview Dallas assistant Sean Sweeney and Minnesota assistant Micah Nori for newly vacant coaching job. Pistons are also planning to interview former Cleveland coach JB Bickerstaff, who'll be available to meet sooner than the rest.

author: wojespn
text: Pistons are expected to call for permission on more assistants too, sources said.

author: wojespn
text: BREAKING: The Chicago Bulls are trading two-time All-Defensive guard Alex Caruso to the Oklahoma City Thunder for guard Josh Giddey, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/V3t12MA3Uo

author: wojespn
text: The trade delivers the Thunder one of the league’s most coveted role players, a 30-year old guard who GM Sam Presti has long pursued for the Western Conference’s No. 1 seed. Caruso’s arrival could be seen as an addition comparable to the Golden State Warriors acquisition of Andre Iguodala in 2013. Both were 30 years old.

author: wojespn
text: The Bulls have been determined to find a playmaker to replace Lonzo Ball, and Giddey , 21, comes with an All-Star potential that would unlikely be realized with the Thunder because of the playmaking starpower who surrounded him. The Bulls will offer him an opportunity to have the ball in his hands and so much more freedom pass and score.

author: ShamsCharania

author: ShamsCharania
text: Days before the NBA playoffs, the Nuggets dismissed Malone in a meeting today. Malone is the winningest coach in franchise history since being hired in 2015 – and led the Nuggets to the 2023 NBA championship.

author: ShamsCharania
text: NBA issued warnings – no further penalties – to Grizzlies' Ja Morant and Warriors' Buddy Hield along with both teams for gestures on Tuesday night, sources tell ESPN. League ruled the celebrations were not intended to be violent in nature, but inappropriate and should refrain.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Cleveland Cavaliers and former first-round pick Chuma Okeke have agreed to a deal, filling the East leaders' final open roster spot, sources tell ESPN. Okeke averaged 17 points, 8 rebounds and 5 assists for NBA G League Westchester this season. https://t.co/WuW3DAWLAM

author: ShamsCharania
text: Okeke also played seven games for the 76ers this season, averaging 6.9 points and 6.1 rebounds.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Steven Adams has rebounded an astounding 22.5% of all Houston misses in his minutes. That would be the highest single-season ORB% in recorded NBA history (since '73-74 for O-boards, minimum 500 minutes), per @bball_ref. His resurgence has been sneakily important for the Rockets.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: And, yes the spelling error in this tweet is intentional. If you know, you know.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Having watched the absolutely unhinged (in the best possible way) finale, I have some "serious" questions for Benny.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: I needed this.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Today's coffee spit take: Official NBA-dot-com video highlights of Raptors-Blazers starting with voiceover person actually saying "The Toronto Raptors, still fighting for Eastern Conference play-in position, taking on the Portland Trail Blazers." Yeah, ok buddy.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: And Grimes had 30 last night. Also Kelly Oubre Jr. deserves some kind of special award for being the most consistently hard-playing/watchable Sixer in Philly's own season of misery.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: One of the stated/implied reasons for the Luka trade was that it supposedly boosted the Mavs championship odds over this season/next. I heartily disagreed despite Luka's calf stuff -- YOU WERE JUST IN THE FINALS! AND '22 WCF! -- and even if that were true, it doesn't justify the trade. But pinning so much on a short window always risked this -- making an injury wave even more devastating than it would otherwise be.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: What are you even supposed to say about what is going on with the Mavs right now? This is an NBA apocalypse.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: See ya in Providence boys!!!! LETS GOOOOOOOOOOOO

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Still nothing in sports like a Curry game. Nothing. Please note the avalanche truly began when Curry hit a 50-plus-foot heave at the halftime buzzer after GSW inbounded w/ 1.5 seconds left. The basketball gods reward those with the courage to heave and punish FG%-preserving cowards.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Also I have a very important NBA update: I still cannot believe Luka Doncic is on the Lakers. Like, literally. I feel like I'm hallucinating every time I watch them play.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Only 1 player in NBA history has hit >42% on 3s while attempting at least 11 per 36 minutes, according to @bball_ref. He has done it 5 times. That player is Steph Curry. Someone else is on pace to become the second player ever in this group: Malik Beasley. Wow. What a season.

text: Williams -- a two-time NBA coach of the year -- was lured to Detroit with a massive six-year deal after leaving the Suns. Now, a new front office makes a change and Detroit will start another search.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Glen Taylor, 83, purchased the Timberwolves for $94 million in 1994.

Now, 31 years later, Taylor agrees to sell for $1.5 billion – the original price tag from his deal with Marc Lore and Alex Rodriguez.

💰💰💰

author: ShamsCharania
text:
ESPN story: After years-long standoff, Glen Taylor has agreed in principle to complete a 100% ownership transfer of the Minnesota Timberwolves and Lynx to Marc Lore and Alex Rodriguez.

https://t.co/gCwuV1HPSX

author: ShamsCharania
text: Glen Taylor has agreed on Marc Lore-Alex Rodriguez acquiring 100% ownership of the Minnesota Timberwolves and Lynx at the same $1.5 billion tag the sides reached in 2021, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: After years long battle, Glen Taylor and Marc Lore-Alex Rodriguez have agreed to complete full ownership to Lore-Rodriguez, sources tell ESPN. Taylor will not appeal Minnesota arbitrators that ruled in favor of Lore-Rodriguez in February. NBA will start transfer process.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
NBA discipline for Pistons-Timberwolves scuffle, sources tell ESPN:

- Isaiah Stewart: 2 game suspension
- Donte DiVincenzo: 1 game suspension
- Ron Holland: 1 game suspension
- Naz Reid: 1 game suspension
- Marcus Sasser: 1 game suspension

author: ShamsCharania
text: Atlanta Hawks guard Dyson Daniels – the NBA's steals leader and a Defensive Player of the Year candidate – is signing a four-year shoe endorsement deal with Adidas, sources tell ESPN. He is averaging 14.1 points, 5.8 rebounds, 4.3 assists and 3.1 steals (the most since 1988-89).

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Phoenix Suns All-Star Kevin Durant is expected to miss at least one week through team's three-game road trip with a left ankle sprain, sources tell ESPN. Suns are 1.5 games out of Play-In with the toughest remaining schedule in the NBA.

More for NBA Today on ESPN at 3 pm ET. https://t.co/grdYpJEPJ5

author: ShamsCharania
text: Notre Dame's Olivia Miles – the projected No. 2 pick in the WNBA draft this month – will forgo the draft and enter NCAA's transfer portal, sources tell ESPN. The 22-year-old top prospect makes unprecedented decision to use her one year remaining of college instead of the draft. https://t.co/NaODcCzc38

author: ShamsCharania
text: Both forgoing the draft as a top 2 projected pick and transferring out of Notre Dame – following a Sweet 16 run – make this unprecedented for Olivia Miles.

Because Memphis declined his 4th year team option, the maximum Sa…

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: RT @BimaThug: @ZachLowe_NBA Griz were limited in what they could offer LaRavia since they declined his fourth year option.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Painful end to what passes for the Marcus Smart era in Memphis. Traded two firsts to get him, one to get off of him. Also, yeah the Grizz have too many rotation guys already, but LaRavia was solid this season. Makes a lot of nitty-gritty winning plays. Should make the Kings rotation.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Between Hunter/Wade (for all your accounting needs)/Okoro/Strus, Cavs have a solid and versatile wing rotation. Same was true with LeVert instead of DAH, but Hunter is a better fit and cost in draft assets worth even a small/medium upgrade.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Hunter's contract is fine, gives CLE some cost certainty with LeVert headed into free agency. Cavs on track to be expensive either way. ATL clears the decks, gets some draft assets, reunites Niang and Quin Snyder just for fun.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Solid trade for Cavs. Hunter fits what they need a little better than LeVert -- spot-up shooting, size -- though LeVert is probably feistier on defense. Hunter playing more decisively this season. Niang's minutes were often limited already, and Hunter can play some PF.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: I am predictably obsessed with the Mark Williams trade. Extended analysis on Instagram -- link in bio, as they say.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: If the pick still has not conveyed by 2026 draft (very unlikely, it would seem), the Heat will receive GSW's 2027 first-round pick unprotected as part of the Butler deal, sources say.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: The Heat are receiving Golden State's 2025 first-round pick, protected for selections 1-10 as part of the Butler trade, sources say. If pick does not convey this year, same protections in 2026.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: I will say, old 3rd option Kuz was a pretty rugged rebounder, solid cutter, fairly willing ball-mover. Wiz Life enabled a different Kuzma, but the prior version could fit well on the Bucks -- provided Kuz makes enough 3s. Career-high is only 36.6%, has not shot >34% since '21.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: We'll see what else Milwaukee does in the next 30 hours --- they are under 2nd apron now, Kuzma's contract declines nicely for them -- but giving up your '24 first (Johnson, who has potential) already in this trade + KM + a pick swap for a 33% career 3-point shooter is a lot

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: No, I'm saying I don't think Kuzma is enough of an upgrade over KM to justify using the pick-now-player in this way.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text:
Perhaps needless to say, the Bucks do not win the 2021 title without Khris Middleton. From 2nd-round pick and trade thrown-in to 3X All-Star and 12-year Buck. Has a case to have his number retired in Milwaukee. Profiled his journey in 2019:

https://t.co/EdRnSKiIoo

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: That is quite a vote of no-confidence in Middleton. A.J. Johnson yet another late 1st-round pick down the drain. It's hard, but just have to hit on more of those in MIL's position. MIL does gain some positional size/versatility on D.  Current Giannis-at-C lineups were too small.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text:
I took a detailed look at the idea of a 40-minute game...11 years ago at @Grantland33. Lots about the league has changed since then, but most of the core issues within the debate are the same. JVG, Nash, Dirk, among those who weighed in back then:

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Kings could wait til summer. Spurs may not have what the Kings want. Sam reports Fox/Klutch will be open to other destinations. Lots of variables in play.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: San Antonio is indeed the team I hear most from sources, and one that makes a ton of sense. One angle here: Kings just fired their coach, clear "make playoffs this season" governing approach. How does a Fox deal fit into that if the return ends up pick-heavy?

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Everyone is buzzing about his game last night, and rightfully so, but go back and watch Thompson's mano-a-mano block on Evan Mobley from a few nights ago. You hardly ever see wings -- or whatever Thompson is -- block bigs straight up in the post like that. I yelped.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Needless to say, Amen Thompson should never come off the bench again. You have to wonder if this week of mega-wins -- and Thompson's explosion -- makes Houston's front office at least a little itchy for even a small or mid-sized win-now move.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Amen Thompson's combination of athleticism, size, and strength is absolutely overwhelming. Houston can put out some lineups -- especially w/ both Terror Twins -- where the mix of speed, strength, and fight just feels suffocating. Almost like OKC w/ young Russ, Ibaka, KD -- just in terms of sheer force/speed.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Among those words was a declaration basically that Miami was not going to give JB a max extension. Few superstars who have led teams to 2 Finals and 1 conf finals are going to respond well to that.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: At the same time, Pat Riley had to know how his comments from the spring/summer would go over with Jimmy. Once he said all of that, we were headed here.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Lots of good stuff in here. The details about Jimmy at times staying at separate lodging from the team are definitely true. However: the idea that the Heat want Jimmy to be some low-usage corner shooter/3-and-D guy is patently ludicrous. There is a huge gulf b/w that and "more Tyler Herro PNRs." Heat would surely welcome co-No. 1 option type situation.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: All-time disaster season unfolding in Philly. Reminder: they owe their first-round pick (top-6 protected) to (of course) the Thunder.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: The player option -- and the possibility of Butler opting into it b/c of the lack of better options -- has been the most under-discussed part of the Jimmy situation for the last year. Everyone is going to have to get creative, now or in July

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Meanwhile the Suns may as well resort to asking the league if they can trade the rights to theoretical third-round picks should the NBA ever expand the draft to 3 rounds.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: One implication of SAC righting itself -- they were IMO the most sensible/realistic Jimmy Butler team. Still struggling to find a realistic deal for the Heat/Butler, but there are 3 weeks to go so who knows.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: What a blast Rox-Kings was. SAC is rolling. Always fun to watch them solve the puzzle of dividing touches/play calls among their 4 best scorers. As self-appointed president of the Tari Eason Is Awesome club, very happy to see him back and doing Tari Eason/Terror Twins things.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Biggest reason for any Celtics anxiety is the top of the East/path to Finals looks much harder than last season. Beyond that (and aside from championship hangover) a few guys not shooting as well + some nights where they could use one more versatile perimeter reserve. Not worried.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: I'm not worried about the Celtics yet -- this stretch reeks of mid-season malaise -- but it is very, very important to note that they deserve to lose when they wear the hideous jerseys they wore last night. The basketball gods took note.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Had like 6-7 plays tonight that had me chuckling, saying "wow" out loud to myself -- and completely fooling Indiana defenders. Garland is one of the most fun players to watch in the league.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Darius Garland's below-the-rim artistry is getting absolutely ridiculous -- off the bounce, as a passer, finishing in the paint with both hands. Incredible skill level, so fun to watch.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: I don't think I've ever re-watched any season of any show in preparation for the upcoming season, but it's time to make an exception -- at least for the last 3-4 episodes of Season 1 -- for Severance @BenStiller. Never seen anything quite like it.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: My work here is done

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: After watching several recent Phoenix Suns games, I have a very important question: Why are Bradley Beal's shoes coming untied multiple times per game? Some working member of the media needs to investigate. He has to lead the league in in-game shoe-tying instances per 36 minutes.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Loss does not take away from monster week + monster month + monster season for OKC. Their defense took NY + BOS out of rhythm, which is very hard to do -- let alone w/o Caruso and Chet. Ran into a great team on the road tonight. Wallace/Wiggins/K. Williams providing more lately

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text:
"There is a lot of Ty Jerome going on."
"Maybe this is too much Ty Jerome?"
"This is the right amount of Ty Jerome!"
"THERE IS NEVER ENOUGH TY JEROME!" 
"Ok, maybe that one play was too much Ty Jerome but WHO CARES?" 

--The Ty Jerome Cycle

text: Developing ESPN story -- Sources: Bill Chisholm agrees to buy Celtics for $6.1 billion: https://t.co/JPnugQuMl3

author: ShamsCharania
text:
The Grousbeck's purchased the Celtics for $360 million in 2002.

In 2025, the family sells for $6.1 billion.

💰💰💰

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Boston Celtics' sale of $6.1 billion surpasses the NFL's Washington Commanders ($6.05 billion) for the highest sum ever for a North America sports team.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Bill Chisholm, managing partner at Symphony Technology Group, has agreed to purchase the Boston Celtics from the Grousbeck family for a valuation for $6.1 billion, sources tell ESPN. This now is the largest sale for a sports franchise in North America. https://t.co/iPphqSQswe

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sacramento Kings star Domantas Sabonis will miss at least 10 days with a right ankle sprain, sources tell ESPN. The NBA's leading rebounder returned last week after sitting for six straight games, and will now miss additional time. Kings are 3-6 without Sabonis.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Sacramento Kings are signing forward Terry Taylor to a 10-day contract out of their NBA G League affiliate Stockton, his agent Darrell Comer tells ESPN. Taylor has averaged 17.5 points, 8.4 rebounds and 3.4 assists for Stockton.

author: ShamsCharania
text: New Orleans Pelicans forward Trey Murphy III has suffered a season-ending torn labrum in his right shoulder, sources tell ESPN. Murphy was in the midst of a career NBA season in his fourth campaign, averaging 21.2 points and posting his third year with 150+ made 3s. https://t.co/vgPQZvRIvX

author: ShamsCharania
text: George spent the past week consulting with doctors on the best treatment options. The 34-year-old suffered two hyperextensions in his knee in October and November, a finger tendon injury in January and dealt with a groin ailment in recent weeks. He played 41 games this season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Philadelphia 76ers' Paul George received injections in his left adductor muscle and left knee on Monday and has been ruled out for the rest of the season, sources tell ESPN. George is expected to be out at least six weeks. https://t.co/TKVvBROp5E

author: ShamsCharania
text: New Boston Celtics owner Bill Chisholm tells ESPN: "The team is in a great place right now, and I'm very sensitive to that. Wyc, Brad (Stevens) and Joe (Mazzulla) have done amazing jobs... My approach is to win and raise banners. That's in the near term and the long term."

author: ShamsCharania
text: Chrisholm: "I bleed green. I love the Celtics. When opportunity came up, I couldn't pass it up. Wyc has done an incredible job. So why would you mess that up? I've had a couple of sitdowns with Brad and it's been about aligning our goals, and extending the window of this team."

author: wojespn
text: BREAKING: The Los Angeles Lakers are targeting Connecticut’s Dan Hurley to become the franchise’s next coach and are preparing a massive, long-term contract offer to bring the back-to-back national champion to the NBA, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/6WPrigPvAW

author: wojespn
text: ESPN Sources: The Lakers have had preliminary contact with Hurley and sides are planning to escalate discussions in coming days. Hurley’s been at the forefront of the Lakers’ search from the beginning of the process, even while the organization has done its due diligence interviewing other candidates.

author: wojespn
text: Rob Pelinka and Jeanie Buss are eager to formally discuss their vision with Hurley of marrying his dominant program --- built upon both his tactical acumen and elite player development -- to the storied Lakers’ brand, sources tell ESPN.

author: wojespn
text: The Cleveland Cavaliers received permission to interview Minnesota Timberwolves assistant Micah Nori for franchise’s head coaching job, sources tell ESPN. Nori has also talked with the Lakers for vacancy there. Nori is an Ohio native. https://t.co/pqmD4u802c

author: wojespn
text: The Cavs also recently received permission to talk to assistants Kenny Atkinson, James Borrego, Johnnie Bryant and Chris Quinn, per sources.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Houston Rockets emerging two-way force Amen Thompson will be sidelined for 10 to 14 days due to a left ankle sprain, sources tell ESPN. MRI on the ankle showed no structural damage, but Thompson will rehab and receive treatment for swelling. https://t.co/ySEfIzF4ld

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Two key Amen Thompson stats this season, per ESPN Research:

- He has held opponents to 39% shooting as the contesting defender, the best in the NBA among players to contest at least 600 shots. 

- He is the only NBA player with at least 75 blocks and 75 steals.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Seven guys in double-figures for the Cavs, and LeVert with 8 that felt big. Strus/Jerome changed the game off the bench. Remember how I always said on the Lowe Post that I would happily take anyone's Evan Mobley stock? I AM NEVER SELLING

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: ---> Yeeeeup

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Just watched Heat-Pels, and let's just say I'm very curious to watch the Heat's next few games.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Had the random good fortune of sitting next to Jonathan earlier this week in Toronto for Rockets-Raptors. He told me the news. The NBA will not be the same without him. Kind and relentless at once -- a rare combination. Enjoy the well-deserved family time!

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: The games were good

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Basketball art: https://t.co/FRhWnMHjBc

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: When basketball is awesome, it's freaking awesome -- Knicks-Spurs was awesome. Bonkers Wemby stuff, Spurs turned into a dunk machine for a bit, and you have to feel great for Bridges who is about all the right things.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: At Raptors-Rockets -- Scottie Barnes has missed a million 3s, but The Raptor mascot came to press row and gave a me a candy cane. So I've got that going for me, which is nice.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: That said, best part of the game was when Giannis hit Dort with the Ultimate Warrior frog splash. Dort did well to kick out. Clearly all those pre-game tunnel WWE sessions from the back in the day are paying off now for the Bucks.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Biggest key to beating OKC (other than having them miss all the 3s) is limiting live-ball TOs and keeping them out of transition. MIL did fairly well there. Giannis defense is trending way up over last 3 weeks. Doc has settled on a rotation/set of lineups. Good stuff.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Denver has long been higher than most rival front offices on LaVine...But...MPJ has also had a probably slightly underrated all-around season, getting to the bucket a bit more/making some tougher plays. Very interesting few weeks coming up for Denver.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Also I know his scoring is down a tick/shooting % is just OK, but I continue to want all the Jabari Smith Jr. stock. Even if he never makes an All-Star team, he is a winning player -- type/size/skill set/personality every good team needs. Great game last night.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Try to shoot a moonball so that a rebound might run out the game clock! Mike Conley did this once in a MEM game I can't recall. Defense can try to pre-empt this by trapping/forcing faster decisions, but HOU had not done that with Steph by time of his pivotal 3 last night.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: That is the sweet spot where the trailing team on defense should *probably* foul, even if they have a T.O. left + especially if they are down 1, as a stop may not leave enough time for them to get real shot on offense. BUT the leading team (GSW) almost never does the optimal thing of letting the shot clock run to almost 0 before shooting.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Re: GSW-HOU -- team trailing on defense with b/w 27-28.5 seconds left (i.e. 3.0-4.5-second difference b/w shot and game clock) is becoming one of the most fascinating coaching decisions in basketball for both offensive and defensive team in that situation.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Digging in on film of Jalen Johnson -- his passing most of all -- and then talking at length w/ him (plus Snyder, others in the org), more I was sure a huge leap was coming. He's really, really good.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Trae's passing has been sensational. Not a sea change in his offensive game, but just enough rebalancing that the ecosystem feels right. ATL has done well to surround him w/ smart cutters -- Johnson, Daniels, ZR, Bogie. One trend feeds the other, and so on. Hunter has been *awesome*.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Psst...Jalen Johnson was the headliner of my (filed/written, but never published) Six Most Intriguing Players column. Dude is going to be an All-Star, maybe not this year but soon. Risacher will be good -- knows how to play. Hawks are fun. I was a year early @TimBontemps!

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Hartenstein was such a perfect signing for OKC. Purely additive. He does so much of what the rest of the roster does not do well or do much of. Adds short roll dimension on offense. Will mesh fine with Chet.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: It takes a special team defense to be able to blitz Luka as often as OKC did last night + not get filleted. OKC is fast and smart across the board. Recovery + rotations out of blitzes were textbook. Some nights, Luka will go nuclear + it won't matter. Didn't have it yesterday

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: LFGM!!!!!

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Down to 21st in points per possession, @cleantheglass has them as a below-average transition offense -- and only getting out in transition at league-average rate. Needless to say, they don't have the defensive infrastructure to be a blah offensive team.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Pacers shockingly disjointed on offense. Out of rhythm in half-court+transition. Bizarre turnovers. Guys not getting ball in obvious situations when they should. General uncertainty. Issues beyond Hali's up/down play  + absence of connector types Nembard/Nesmith/Sheppard.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text:
Thibs, literary figure: 

https://t.co/DFszhLj9I2

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: For MEM, will be interesting to see who emerges as most reliable pairing around Ja/Bane/JJJ -- esp when Edey/Williams Jr./GG get back. Super deep team. Did not enjoy the Marcus Smart experience last night, could do without the early clock 3s in semi-transition.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Mavs remain absolutely rock-solid. Lively is awesome. Grimes getting spicier off the bounce (steal of a trade w/ DET considering it was a $ dump). Dinwiddie providing a lift. PJW adding variety on both ends (guarding Morant, posting smalls, off-the-bounce juice).

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Meanwhile, look at the how the Hornets were guarding Maxey in the weak-side corner off-ball during PG's crunch-time pick-and-rolls. That is Klay/Steph-level face-guarding respect, opened up a ton of real estate for PG and his screeners. https://t.co/aUUsNmLcBh

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Welcome to the NBA season, Paul George! Like PG's aggression on drives in the 2nd half, kinda worming his way into the paint and finding drop-off passes. Needed win for Philly. The Martin twins playing against each other still breaks my brain a few times per game.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Small, important thing I've liked re: Bucks resurgence: anecdotally, seems like a little more creative cooperation b/w GA+Dame on offense--more split actions involving both off-ball, more Dame screening here+there for GA. Prince hitting everything, Green playing solid 2-way ball.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: To be 15-7 w/ Banchero having played in only 5 games -- plus 13 of first 22 on the road -- is tremendous stuff. Jamahl Mosley will be a leading COY candidate again, players are all playing super hard and smart.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Anyone craving old-school, physical, defense-first basketball needs to make the Orlando Magic appointment viewing. It's not just that they are good at defense. They enjoy it.  They're mean. They want to unnerve you. They are into *every* action. Every hand-off is perilous.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Happy Thanksgiving! Any Coach of the Year quarter poll *has to* include Ty Lue, way toward the top. Not sure the Clips can quite keep this up, but 12-8 w/o Kawhi is well above what I expected. Solid schedule, some mild opp 3p FG% luck, but Clips are tough and together.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: And blanket statement for season: Kevin Durant is locked the F in on both ends of the floor. Super engaged, focused play, even by his all-time standards. PHX legit dangerous if they can stay healthy.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Case for starting Knecht over Reddish -- watch first ~7min 3Q last night, Tyus Jones hides on Reddish + Reddish spends entire stretch standing in r. corner.  New LAL starting 5 is -21 in 65 minutes. Small sample. Reddish better on D, but off-def trade-offs are stark regardless.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: I love Mike Conley, you love Mike Conley, we all love Mike Conley -- multi-time Lowe Post podcast guest. But Conley is 37, shooting 32%, and now injured -- and that has been a huge simmering story all year for MIN. They need an organizer badly.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: On much simpler level, whole conception of Wolves team falls apart if DDV/McDaniels are going to combine to shoot 31% on 3s. DDV especially needs to find last year's form. Bright side: Dillingham is ready for a real role, brings exactly what Wolves brain trust drafted him for.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Wolves 12th on offense, OK, but they fall out of rhythm way too easily. Even before Toronto Incident, you could have made a long compilation of Randle driving + Rudy calling for the lob -- + not getting it. Which isn't always a bad decision by Randle by the way.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: HOOK WOLVES-ROCKETS TO MY VEINS! HOU starters w/ Thompson for Green now +38 in 53 mins w/ a defensive rating of [SHRIEKING NOISE]. Green a little off-kilter on offense, even when he goes into pass-first mode the timing is sometimes like 5% off. Working on D though.

text: I trust in the resourcefulness of the NBA community, but it's zachlowenba

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: About to watch their game from last night. In general, tough as all hell. Schedule has helped. Franz making a leap, Black leveling up. Goga always handy to have around, playing great. A young, hungry team who knows who they are. Offense will wane some nights, but even then they are a tough out.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: That said, envy/bitterness from West execs +coaches re: state of East might be at all-time high due to Sixers/Bucks struggles not totally burying them. There is time. Maxey is coming. Embiid will be better. Most fun subplot of potential Vegas/Seattle expansion will be West teams lobbying to move East.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: 3 games, illness + injury/recovery, so grains of salt -- but most alarming thing w/ Embiid so far is how tentative + uncertain he looks on offense. Unsteady. Mobility issues on D/boards bleeding into offense. Not demanding ball as much. Jumper looks a bit off/more easily blocked/contested.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: It is a really, really special thing. You never had to wonder what Klay was thinking, feeling. All-time steely competitor. "He loses the way you want a player to lose," Ron Adams once told me. "It strikes him to the heart." No one who was there will ever forget the roar when he came out to shoot those FTs.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: The connection b/w GSW fans and Klay is one of those rare, magical sports things where an elite talent with a totally genuine, relatable personality lands on the kind of team where he can turn that talent into big moments. There are great players who might spend their entire careers in one place and will never quite hit this sweet spot.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Dyson Daniels is averaging 3.6 steals/game. All-time record (min: 1K minutes) per @bball_ref is 3.7/game by Alvin Robertson in '86. (NBA did not record steals til '73-74 season). Daniels leads NBA in deflections w/ 76. No. 2 is tie b/w Alex Caruso +Nikola Jokic...at 44. Insane.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Tari Eason and Amen Thompson are doing extremely rude things to opponents on defense. Most entertaining bench tag team in the league, both making strong cases to start if Ime Udoka ever feels the need to shake things up.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Pink, red, yellow, orange is the order, come on I am a serious person here.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Watching the Bulls is like eating an entire pack of Starburst (Halloween was 12 days ago) -- super fun in the moment, not gonna lead you anywhere productive beyond that, and there's always one thing in the mix (orange Starburst) you don't really want in there.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: The playoffs are the ultimate test of CLE's double-big alignment, but Cavs fans should be thrilled by this start.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Who has two thumbs and kept all his Mobley stock? THIS GUY. Too many people shoved his ceiling way too low b/c at ages *21 and 22* a 6-11 big hadn't developed into a reliable NBA 3-point shooter yet. He still hasn't, but rest of his game all trending up. The NBA is hard. Give guys time.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Everything Kenny Atkinson touches turning to gold right now. Sits entire core 4 late 3Q, Cavs blitz CHI w/ group of Jerome/Merrill/LeVert/Wade/Niang. SURE! Ball is popping, chemistry off the charts. Garland/Mitchell sharing ball w/in possessions, each happy to let the other cook as matchups dictate.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Issue w/ Brooklyn in any potential one star trade is the "who's left for me to play with?" problem when the star gets there. That star would have to a) not care and/or b) trust the front office to trade for or sign another star/more quality players in short order. Possible, but tough. MIL surely isn't ready for any of this, but the noise won't stop if they keep losing (and it has looked bad).

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: They are very good +very deep + I'm still trying to figure out how far I think they could really go given gap b/w Steph and whoever is No. 2 on a given night. Lots of good players + I think it's probably time for everyone to give Steve Kerr every benefit of the doubt. Elite coach

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Hell no. Luka is incredible, voted him No. 2 in MVP last season. Mavs will be fine. Rock solid team dealing w/ injuries. Not a shot at Giannis either. MIL has a lot of issues right now, his play is not one. It was a shot at no one, just a comment on the toughness of the Nuggets.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: This is a form of toughness -- steadying your season amid injuries and some internal friction. This is what real contenders do when met with adversity. Having the best player in the world at the (ever-rising) peak of his powers is the ultimate failsafe.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Jokic-Kyrie last night was absolute all-time stuff. Ten games in, Joker averaging 30/14/12, leading NBA in *both* assists and rebounds. I mean, what. Braun/Watson/Strawther developing into what DEN needs them to be. Malone pressing right buttons. DEN 7-1 in last 8.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: /cues up Tankathon. One of these "how are we in dire straights already!?!?" teams is going to pivot into tank mode at some point. "Yeah, Player X needs 6 more weeks on that ankle sprain." And yes I know the Pels have partial rights to MIL's first round pick as well.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Another very normal season for the Sixers in a decade-plus-long streak of totally normal basketball seasons.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text:

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text:
I went to Minnesota and brought a gift for the Wolves:

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Back on NBA Today in August/Sept, I repeatedly named MIL as both the team under most pressure and the biggest potential storyline in the NBA. It's still very early, Middleton's return at some point is a huge help, but this thing needs to turn sooner rather than later.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Offense lacks flow. Chemistry/connectivity b/w Dame and Giannis still isn't where it needs to be. Doc going back to Jackson Jr. last 2 games screams "we just need some freaking speed + athleticism out there," + AJJ stands out in that regard -- probably too much. Red alert stuff.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Another *extremely* disconcerting loss for the Bucks last night. Sure, some bad shooting luck (9/42 on 3s), but absolutely run off the floor. Every team making a point to bully MIL guards. More teams putting Dame in ball screens. Ton of demoralized body language/miscommuniction

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: This one hurts. A few solid rotation guys taken shortly after him -- Jovic, Nembhard, P. Watson -- but draft in this range is generally a crap shoot. That said, team in MIL's position (expensive, aging, picks traded out the door) has to hit once every X years to be sustainable.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Could get into actions earlier, run PNRs designed to get smaller/weaker defenders on Wemby, and attack from there. Some cross screens too. Stops/transition would help. Pop + staff are 100X smarter than I am and surely in the lab. They really miss Jones and esp Vassell's shooting

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Spurs issue is simple: Every team is now putting their Cs on Sochan, guarding Wemby with wings, switching/taking away the easy stuff. Not even sure Spurs have a non-Sochan lineup that would force opponents to guard Wemby with Cs. They have to get more creative, Wemby more forceful

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Hawks obviously super banged-up, but transition defense and defense on cuts was very bad tonight. Nice games from both Bub and K. George for Wiz too. Jonas playing some bully ball.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Wiz have to be ecstatic w/ Coulibaly's early-season play. Shooting 3s w/ confidence, attacking the + glass, running the offense for stretches -- and guarding Trae Young well 2 straight games. Trae putting up #s tonight, but has to work for everything. 2/15 last game vs WAS

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Thought Denver got into a better rhythm in 2nd half on offense last night vs BKN (who, yes, missed key FT and open 3 to win in regulation.) May need to keep two of Jamal/MPJ/Strawther on floor almost all the time. Team concept wobbles if Jokic is clearly 2nd best shooter out there. Nets feisty!

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Bucks and Nuggets somewhat predictably having a "it's not going great"-off in the early going.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Luka dribbling deep on the right wing in Minnesota late in games has to give Minny fans the shakes now. Very rude behavior. Kyrie was tremendous, Lively and Gafford do their thing damn near every game. Tough team. You have to play well to beat them.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Mavs are just rock solid across the board. MIN finding its way, bleeding rebounds and points when Gobert rests but blah on offense w/ Randle/Rudy pairings. (It's *very* early, duh.) ANT has missed some box outs too. Liked Finch taking a look at smaller group in 4Q w/ Jaden at PF

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: CUE THE JINGLE! For all your accounting needs! @deanwade3232

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: And similar to Redick with AD, Kenny Atkinson is feeding Mobley some more reps as PNR ball-handler. The Mobley/Merrill inverted PNR caused NY some issues. KAT with 6 3PAs in three games isn't going to cut it given early issues on defense.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: In other news: PAOOOLLLLOOOOOO! Wow. Love the trust in Anthony Black to hit corner 3s against rotating D. Keep an eye on him. Slow start for Hali, PNR volume significantly down. Team should be fine, you know the Hali eruption is coming.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Great, great win for the Cavs last night at MSG. Scoring isn't off the charts or anything, but I've loved Mobley's mentality so far -- more physical, confident, nastier. Recall Cavs were my strongest "over" in a few September Lowe Post episodes. They are good. NYK still figuring life out.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Dallas/Luka committing to play w/ pace -- esp after misses -- since acquiring Kyrie has been the most important macro change in their style. Even more dangerous w/ Klay running wings. Spain PNR w/ Klay as back-screener is predictably going to be a problem for defenses (Spurs were flummoxed).

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Will try to highlight that defense on Instagram later -- account link for IG is in Twitter/X bio. Onto Mavs-Spurs.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: What an opening statement from OKC. Best part -- Chet's work off the bounce/passing when Denver gave him space/played a semi-zone against him with Jokic dropping off and shifting to another OKC player lower on the floor. A. Wiggins also showed a new level attacking off the dribble.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Currently cackling at Draymond almost single-handedly stopping two Portland fast breaks in a 15-second span early 3Q. No one has ever played the man-down cat-and-mouse game better.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Watching GSW-POR...bit surprised GSW started super-big w/ all Wigs/JK/Dray/TJD tho I get the reasoning. We'll see if it sticks. No team has more interesting lineup choices. It's small, but Steph/Buddy/Podz trio is really fun and tough to guard. POR with some, umm, puzzling rotations on D.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: Also caught DET-IND, nothing huge there other than I have seen so many "promising Pistons fall from ahead" home losses. 28 minutes for Mathurin vs 19 for Nesmith (4 fouls) worth monitoring as IND tries to figure out what they have in their young guys. (J. Walker just 6 shaky mins).

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: It's Tre Mann pull-alllllll-the-waaaaaay back 3 season, baby. LaMelo with a "this is why I can never quit LaMelo" game, love the 10 FTAs. Houston has a lot of interesting lineup dilemmas. Congrats to Charles Lee on his first official W.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: KAT with just 2 3PAs in 24 minutes b/c of how Boston was matching up/playing him, meanwhile Boston takes a gazillion 3s thanks to calculated offense aimed at KAT/Brunson. Bridges screen navigation can be better too. Guess JT's jumper is OK. BOS = very very good, my title pick.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: NYK is thin, injured, and very early developing chemistry -- which really showed tonight. All that will improve. Boston is the favorite for a reason. But Celts also went at KAT on *both* ends the way a lot of good, smart teams will, and NYK responded poorly. It's early. 81 left.

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: And while we're here, a HUGE thank-you to the @Mets for a fun distraction. I'm back in, and I won't drift so far back out again. One day, it will happen -- good will triumph again. #LGM

author: ZachLowe_NBA
text: HAPPY NBA OPENING NIGHT!!!!! Only prediction I'll share here: Celtics over Thunder in the 2025 NBA Finals, Boston breaks the NBA's no-repeat streak. I'll be watching, talking to/meeting with people around the league, traveling a bit to games -- the usual. Enjoy the games!

author: MarcJSpears
text: NBA commissioner Adam Silver announces that the NBA is now exploring a European league after Board of Governors meeting.

author: MarcJSpears
text: 16 teams, 12 legacy and four rotating.

author: MarcJSpears
text: Silver says NBA deputy commissioner Mark Tatum will lead the efforts.

author: MarcJSpears
text: Silver said they're looking at existing facilities, but also potentially "new state of the art arenas." Silver also said they're looking at size of cities, including those are well-known, successful and have notable basketball history.

author: MarcJSpears
text: "It's early days. Literally nothing has been agreed upon yet," Silver said. Silver added that he did want to honor the current FIBA and Euro format with 40-minute games and such.
